flores_passage: Sleep disruption is a way of waking up at your normal bedtime and falling asleep quickly within 10-60 minutes. This can easily be done by using a silent alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you up. If you find that you simply turn off the timer when it wakes you up, it can be placed on the other side of the clock, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options include drinking a lot of water (especially water or tea, commonly known as a diuretic) before bed, forcing one to get up to urinate.

flores_passage: The Sundarbans is the most indented coastline in the world, stretching 80 km (50 miles) into Bangladesh and inland from the coast. The Sundarbans has been declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Part of the forest in the middle of India is called the Sundarbans National Park. The forests are not mangrove swamps - but comprise the last remnants of the great forests that once covered the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered by water/wetlands. Since 1966 the Sundabans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and there are currently an estimated 400 Royal Bengal tigers and 30,000 spotted tigers in the region.
question: According to the text, which of the following statements about the Sundarbans are false?

mc_answer2: Half of it is covered by swamp
mc_answer3: It is the largest wetland in the world
mc_answer4: It is home to more spotted deer than the Bengal tiger
